website_summaries.verdict: This high-tech lighting home solution makes it easy to control lights with the click of a button, either using the app or via a smart home system.
pros: Doesn’t require smart home hub for use, although switch easily integrates with these systems
Possesses “night mode” ability to ensure you won’t be blinded in the middle of the night
App allows users to control multiple lights at once with just one click
cons: May be difficult to connect to Wi-Fi if signal is weak

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if you want to sleep through the night
customer_reviews.text: This switch has a glowing light on it. Expect the switch to light itself up periodically, even during the middle of the night. No way to control this. Would otherwise be a decent product. Don’t buy if you enjoy sleeping through the night.
customer_reviews.author: FunnerRunner

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE GARBAGE GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: Well they worked well for about a year then it all went down hill im at the point now where they will not connect and just are useless im going to get great pleasure in smashing them I have wasted a week of my life trying to get them to work again to no avail. JUNK!!!! do not buy this or and belkin wemo product
customer_reviews.author: jv

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased three of these and had to replace every one of them within a year. If there is the slightest hiccup in power, they become unrecoverable and have to be re-initialized. And it doesn't matter if it's a switch or a dimmer - they all become unresponsive. Then some come back. Then they go out again. Then some others come back. Then they go out, too. I have switches and dimmers from other manufacturers and they hardly ever misbehave. Save yourself time, trouble and money by looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: WildWillieHitch

customer_reviews.title: Modern Switch
customer_reviews.text: The dimmer switch has a modern look with active touch control and function well when there is uninterrupted power. When power is interrupted for a period of time, a black out, one must manually reconfigure the settings. The installation process and the apps is non-intuitive and the firmware update take a long time; user is not notify when it it is completed. The switch surface temperature measured at 95 Deg F and feels warm to the touch even when the lights are off. I like the design and function of this switch but will not use it because don't want to reset after each power loss and the heat that it generate may be a potentially fire hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Tclown

customer_reviews.title: Move on...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these...a little disappointed. Won't link to Alexa, I've read how to fix it...why do I have to manage their product? The other WeMo non dimmer switches and plugs I have all work fine but the dimmer ones are not worth the money and time. YUCK! The dimmer "touch" portion of the switch is quirky and sometimes doesn't register your fingertip. Annoying! Sometimes the switch is unavailable on the app. WeMo is huge! Why are they putting out products that have issues? I'm moving on to the next WIFI switch guy.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Mifflin

customer_reviews.title: Great smart home addition
customer_reviews.text: Purchased primarily to use on our switch that controls our exterior house lights. Main reason we purchased was to use the timer feature and have it turn on our lights at night automatically while we vacation. That feature works great. Apple HomeKit didn’t work at first but a recent firmware fixed the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Addy

customer_reviews.title: Works great - but make sure you have good wifi
customer_reviews.text: I installed 13 separate Wemo Switches in our house (together with a licensed electrician - recommended!) and after relatively little effort got them all working with the Wemo App and Alexa. One thing we found is that the switches are sensitive to wifi signal strength - I ended up repositioning a mesh router as a result to reach the farthest switch, but that was an easy fix. Overall very happy, although the HomeKit integration is still a bit of a mystery... Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle G. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Make sure that your switch has a neutral wire.
customer_reviews.text: This works with my Google assistant great, and fits into a double gang box like mine perfectly. The switch itself needs to be powered so make sure there is a neutral wire (white) in your home switch box. Works with my dimmable LEDs great.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnydont

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: We installed a new light fixture that was considerably brighter and decided that we needed a dimmer. I did a little research and it seemed this was a good option. It arrived quickly, and the instructions were very simple clear. Install took about 15 minutes. It does require a neutral wire... but other wise it’s a pretty standard install. Set it up in Wemo quickly, and then connected to Alexa. Works like a charm. No issues (so far) with losing connection or requiring restarts. All in all a very good connected dimmer.
customer_reviews.author: WCK

customer_reviews.title: took forever to install
customer_reviews.text: as with all my other wemo products, it took weeks to get working. this time i had to give up initializing it via my phone and use someone else's. it is always something with these things... from not detecting, to not turning on/off. also, more specifically to this dimmer in particular... there isnt an option to control how it turns on and off.... its just boom, straight to x%. you shoudl be able to adjust how long of a fade on and off there is.
customer_reviews.author: wezzz

customer_reviews.title: Looks great with great controls. Network is unstable and app is aweful.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, looks good and works wonderfully when it's connected. I had several times of it disconnecting from our network and just didn't want to reconnect. I haven't had any issues recently, so hopefully this was a software fix. I really like the look of this dimmer and that it's not overly sensitive to touch inputs. The app should make it easy to setup your device, but unfortunately the app is the problem with the Wemo devices. Sorry Wemo, it's true. My Amazon devices don't always want to control this dimmer, but my Google devices have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Call

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service and product
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through two of these and had different issues on both one would never work with the app. The new one failed after 2 months and now will not respond to physical touch and crashes the app as soon as I touch it. I have 5 normal switches I my house but will replace them all because custome service closes case without even talking to you. Just bad all around
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: HomeKit integration has issues
customer_reviews.text: I like the switch. The Wemo app is easy use. Setting up the device took a couple of tries. A 10 minute task ended up being 45 minutes. I updated the Wemo firmware and app to support HomeKit. It connected to HomeKit but then stopped responding in HomeKit. While trying to reset it, it was removed from HomeKit. Now I can’t connect it to HomeKit. I will contact support.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you prepare!
customer_reviews.text: First off, you need to know that this doesn’t work for all set ups. This will not work if you have a 3-way switch, unless you bypass one switch. Next, not all LED dimmable lights work with WEMO. I highly recommend Cree 40W or 60W LED dimmable bulbs with this switch, as they have excellent range for dimming, make no noise or flicker, and can be purchased from Home Depot. Do not use GE or EcoSmart LEDs bulbs, as they will either not dim at all or make noise when dimmed. If you plan ahead of time and have a good WiFi signal, this will work great!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: it's too bad Wemo is one of only a few names in ...
customer_reviews.text: After just 2 days I'm already having wifi connection issues. It's very sluggish to cellphone and google assistant commands and the dimmer often takes 2 or 3 slides to register. Not worth the 70$, it's too bad Wemo is one of only a few names in the game. I keep wanting to like Belkin products and they continue to fail me whether it be routers, dimmer switches or even ethernet cables... 5/12/2018 Update: Has not had any more connection issues in several months now. Updating my review to a 4 star as they seem to have fixed the issues and it's providing the remote functionality that we were expecting.
customer_reviews.author: M_A_DataAnalyst

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This product was very easy to install and works great. I recommend getting a circuit tester beforehand. I had to wait a few extra days for one before I installed the WEMO. It is very easy to install. I followed the directions and it worked perfectly. It conmnected to my phone with the app and worked the first time. Great buy. I do recommend buying some electrical tape to wrap the wires after installation. Five stars for the product and it's operation.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Adams

customer_reviews.title: It works. Getting it on HomeKit wasn't so straightforward.
customer_reviews.text: Just installed it. It requires a neutral wire, which my outlet has. Took about 2 minutes. Then to get it on HomeKit. Mine had no HomeKit code or barcode to scan. Most HomeKit devices can go straight on the Home app, but this one requires set wireless setup through the Wemo app first. Then use one of the functions buried in the Wemo app to get it on the Home app. The wall switch looks great, works great, and controlling through the Home app works great too.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Arpawong

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup an install
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my existing dimmer switch with this one. It was very easy to install and setup. You do need a neutral wire. The documentation showed two neutral wires to connect to in order to use the dimmer. I only have one, but the dimmer still worked with it. The app and Alexa integration was very easy. Not only do I have the switch paired to turn on and off with the rest of my wi-fi light bulbs via voice, but I can also brighten and dim the switch via voice commands by percentage. That's a bonus I didn't know this switch could do.
customer_reviews.author: masing

customer_reviews.title: It's a real pain to set up... and I know I'm not alone here
customer_reviews.text: I was super chill when beginning to install this. but it was ridiculously unclear how to install. By the end of the install I wanted to rip it out of the wall. I talked to a friend who had also bought one, and he literally smashed his through anger.. and he's a calm guy.. So yeah.. nicely made product, nice packaging, very clear connection instructions.. USLESS SETUP, enough to make one totally loose it and smash things.
customer_reviews.author: CRIS BLYTH

customer_reviews.title: Smart switch went stupid-er after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Initially I could never set it up to work even with Wemo app, forget Alexa. Today, the dimmer just died... top LED is lit, but the click no longer turns on the light. Reset didn't work. LED bar stays off, regardless of what I do. Looks like this one is destined for the junk bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Marko

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst smart device I’ve ever tried installing
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worthless. After finally getting it installed I could connect to its own WiFi but it would never let me connect it to my home wifi. After searching endlessly in belkins site I stared reading reviews from the Wemo app on the App Store. Everyone has problems with this device. I’ve received it this afternoon. Installed it this evening. Spent way too much time with it with no luck. I removed it from my wall and it is being returned tomorrow. I’ve already purchased a GE smart dimmer instead and will see how that goes. Avoid this awful device at all costs. Save your time and buy something else
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: As a light dimmer it is great and looks cool on the wall. As a smart product it only works with its own app less than 50% of the time, HomeKit even less and I can’t even connect to Alexa. I have almost 20 smart products in my home and this is the least reliable. I even called support and the had me do a bunch of resetting (that I had already done) and then wait 24h to see if it was better...it was not.
customer_reviews.author: RE

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This product is a piece of flaming garbage, in one case literally. Be prepare to set this thing up for as long as you have it. Constant losing connection to the HomeKit/Alexa. Trying to fix it even with support help boils down to “delete it all and reinstall everything”. So if you really love being super frustrated and angry at a crap product with garbage support buy away. Buyer beware; DO NOT BUY ANYTHING WEMO, THEY ARE GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.author: KB Ray

customer_reviews.title: Very good (when they work)
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Dimmer Wifi light switch for my Kitchen LED lights now for about four months, the only recurring issue is that they will not respond to commands (or even the switch itself) periodically. After finding out (thanks YouTube) how to "reset" the switch, (shut-off the breaker and re-energize) then the issue is resolved (until it happens again). Other than that issue, the WeMo works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jotave751

customer_reviews.title: Horrible app, non stop issues
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the hassle, randomly quits working once a month and after a couple months decided to never reconnect to the app. Annoying blue blinking never stops because it will never reconnect. Tried dozens of times every couple of days. Randomly requires to reset breakers since factory reset button stops working. End product is a pretty much a regular switch because it never even connects, and if you manage to set it up it will randomly stop working in a month.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: the dimmer was easy to configure
customer_reviews.text: I had a bugger of a time connecting the WeMo plug initially. But once I got that working, the dimmer was easy to configure. I'm knocking off one star because as a family one of the devices was hard to install. I'm also knocking off a star because no sooner did I get everything up and running, it wanted to update the firmware. You should have done that at the time of the initial install. In trying to get the plug working I read horror story after horror story of people that had their WeMo devices running only to lose everything when you do a firmware upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Surprise Oma

customer_reviews.title: HomeKit Buyers beware
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace another brand non-dimmer smart switch that had died. We use Apple HomeKit to connect all our smart devices in the house. We chose this switch because the bulbs we got from Costco are dimmable, and the switch claims to support HomeKit. Long story short, Belkin pushed out a firmware updated last fall that breaks the dimmer’s HomeKit capability. I called support, and they were aware of the issue, but had no timeline on when another update would be pushed out. Overall, I think it’s a pretty good product, but since it specifically doesn’t do what I bought it for, and it claims it can do, I am giving this low rating.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Nielson

customer_reviews.title: REally good product - needs just a little more refinement.
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a WiFi dimmer. giving it a 4 because there are missed opportunities for improvement. There is a timed dim-to-off function in the app. Great for getting ready for bed and having the lights fade out. Would be AMAZING if they allowed a "long press" to operate this function. Would also be AMAZING if they allowed the status bar at the bottom to be controlled in the app so it could be used as a nightlight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Apple Homekit
customer_reviews.text: The product does not work with Apple Homekit. I spent hours to connect the device to HomeKit. Wemo's hotline claimed the dimmer is malfunctioning and should return it. The second device showed exactly the same behavior. one can only control the device via the Wemo app, but not HomeKit. I spent again much time with Wemo's hotline and 2nd level support over 3 days. Eventually level 2 support stated they have unknown issues and I should wait until the problem would possibly be solved in weeks or months.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schwab

customer_reviews.title: Great switch
customer_reviews.text: This switch has been excellent. I can see how people might complain about the manual dimming, but I rarely physically use the switch. The wifi has also been great, but I do have it in the same room as my router. I will purchase it again when I upgrade more light fixtures in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon, Joesabelle, & Isabelle

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, simple to install, works well with Alexa, and no hub.
customer_reviews.text: A little more expensive than the L_ _ _ _ n competitive brand, and a little bulkier (installation volume), and no remote, BUT does not need a hub, and works quite smoothly. The 'autocalibration' for the type of lights I used as load worked beautifully, and automatically (following the simple guidance provided in the very clear instructions). Bought another 1, as soon as I finished the install, I was so impressed with it. Very well packaged, and protected during shipment. Only have a few days experience with it, so far; time will tell... Use Alexa to control it, so I don't need a separate remote.
customer_reviews.author: eba

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: After 5 years of Amazon Prime, this is my first review. Most things in here, you get what you pay for. That’s why I spent a few extra dollars with this product to make sure I was able to connect with Apple HomeKit. Well...after many calls to tech support, I’ve been notified that their engineers are aware of the incompatibility and are”working” on the problem. Meanwhile....they keep lining their pockets with our money toting an Apple HomeKit compared product that is not. As a Technical Director by trade, it infuriates me to witness such false advertising. Belkin should be ashamed for toting HomeKit compatibility without connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Latshaw

customer_reviews.title: Flickering Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my home and they would not work. As soon as you connect them it’s a flickering nightmare. I tried it with both incandescent bulbs and LED bulbs. I figured it was something to do with the electrical in an old apartment (mind you, I had installed 3 others from a different brand and 2 years later they still work like magic.) So I saved them for another residence which was under renovation. Well, I just tried to install them and guess what...full flickering galore. By now I’m way past the return window so I have no choice but to trash them.
customer_reviews.author: PRdrumr

customer_reviews.title: I got this as a gift and I love it. It works great with your Alexa and ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift and I love it. It works great with your Alexa and IFTTT. Love that you can tell Alexa to turn it on and off as well as dim it to a specific percentage. Love the long press functionality and night mode. Wish there were more smart push modes to let you do different things but the long press is nice to have. Install and setup was really easy so I had it up and running in no time. Only thing that is a little wonky is selecting the dim setting on the switch. you sort of slide your finger up and down the little bar which works fine but feels a little awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Will Burns

customer_reviews.title: WeMos for new renovation
customer_reviews.text: Installed 7 WeMo dimmers in a home that was a recently completed renovation. These switches work great and have made the transition to a smart home simple. Pros: -Can still operate without a Wifi connection if necessary - Nice look, can be covered by standard outlet cover - Easy to operate, nice subtle touch of the button - Easy visual for on and off - Connects to Alexa easily for smart control Cons: - Can be difficult to connect to WiFi network in first couple attempts - Reference serial number is only found inside the light (not like the smart switch), so Document which switch is which before going active
customer_reviews.author: T Lesinski

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: No more waking up in the dark to make coffee, I just set the timer and my kitchen light turns on every morning when I wake up. I also love the long press feature that allows you to toggle a different WeMo device by holding the switch for a few seconds. I have a lamp that is difficult to reach, so having this act as the remote light switch really helps. I've had many occasions where I have left the light on accidentally, and it's incredibly easy to open up the app and turn off the light.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: The instructions were clear and easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: Setup of the dimmer was exactly as expected. The instructions were clear and easy to follow. The only grip I have is that the dimmer does not directly integrate with Alexa/Echo like the smart plugs or the regular switch. To use the dimmer with Alexa/Echo you have to connect it via the Wemo "skill" which works, but it's a little slower/less responsive then direct integration. Sometimes it can take ~10 seconds for Alexa to turn my lights on since it has to first connect via the app. I can't understand why Alexa can't connect directly to this switch, as Alexa can still only turn it on or off, it cannot control the dimming functions or anything beyond a simple on/off.
customer_reviews.author: M Twain

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. It will not tie into the wireless
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. It will not tie into the wireless. I have tried everything possible. It will not let me return the product and it costs a lot. There is no product support. I even went on line to try to find the answers and nothing works. This product does not work in MANY cases as I have read. I do not suggest using it. There are many other products that serve this purpose. If you want to buy it cheap call me. Ill sell it to you at 50% off and still in the box.
customer_reviews.author: MT Lotz, LLC

customer_reviews.title: The modern age boggles my mind!
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 Wemo plugs currently in use on lamps, so added this dimmer light switch from Wemo. Installation was straightforward, though I did have to consult the web on figuring out line vs load wires. We already use the app, and adding this switch was simple and straightforward. Setting a schedule for this overhead light, including both time and dimming level, is tremendous. Remains to be seen over the coming months whether we see a slight decrease in our electric bill.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Gutstein

customer_reviews.title: Randomly stops working
customer_reviews.text: This is a good switch/dimmer when it works. I’ve been using it for several years and it frequently stops responding both in the app and at the physical switch. To reset it I need to shut the breaker off aNd back on to reset it. it’s a major pain esp. when you’re in bed and want it off...
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: I have three and they all keep going inactive.
customer_reviews.text: They seem to react to rules some of the time. If I try to access any of the three with my Ipad all of them go grey, then I get to do a reset. I have over twenty Kasa dimmers, I had one fail and it was replaced. I have 36 items logged into my router right now and the only devices that have problems are the Wemo dimmers, what an absolute waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I’ve had nothing but good to say about The Wemo products I’ve purchased over ...
customer_reviews.text: (Update) After talking with customer service I ended up changing my router to a less congested channel, and my dimmer switch has not disconnected since. I’ve had nothing but good to say about The Wemo products I’ve purchased over the years. But unfortunately I’m disappointed in the Wemo dimmer I bought a few weeks ago. Twice now I’ve gone to turn it on, only to find that it’s dissapeared from the network. Each time I’ve found that it is on its own created network and I need to set it up again via the app. Fortunately it continues to function as a phisical switch and will turn on or off manually.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: NOT for HomeKit users
customer_reviews.text: It installs easily and works with the Wemo app, but the box says “HomeKit” and it doesn’t work with HomeKit. The Wemo app can’t connect it to HomeKit and there’s no HomeKit code available. Support is not helpful, at first denying the issue and then admitting that they’re stumped (that was weeks ago...)
customer_reviews.author: Louis J. Flemal

customer_reviews.title: Effective remote switch, subject only to Alexa quirks.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Better than most Alexa compatible products since it stays linked where other brands occasionally lose their connections to Wi-Fi and/or Alexa. Installs in a few minutes but it’s good to have some basic knowledge of electrical wiring and connectors. But it’s DIY and the switch is well insulated with solderless connectors. Wemo app is pretty intuitive and works well.
customer_reviews.author: G. Garrick

customer_reviews.title: Works until power outage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Worked great until we had a bad storm and 3 hour power outage. Now no matter what I do the lights flicker. I have 3 wemo dimmer and 5 wemo regular switches. All 3 lights on dimmers now flicker. I've reset, factory reset, turned breakers off to reset, and recalibrated for every bulb type. Nothing has worked to resolve the issue. Would not recommend the dimmer switch. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: forget about warranty , and 50% chance for getting it work
customer_reviews.text: forget about warranty , i returned one directly after purchase , non working condition , second one lasted for about less than 4 months , need to reset it by disconnected every while , and i contacted Amazon , but no go , contacted the seller for the 1 year warranty , again NO GO ... not even a reply back for more than 2 months already id never buy this again , was planing to get more for the new guest house addition , ill go with another brand or cancel the idea of having "smart" switches !
customer_reviews.author: garo avakian

customer_reviews.title: Not User Friendly
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product for use with Apple Home Kit. The box says it is compatible, but after installation you lean there is a secret code. No problem, right? Wrong, the code is hidden on the back of the device you just installed in your wall. No warning about this until you search the internet. Tried to call customer support but no one ever answered. Sure it would be easy to just place a sticker in the instuctions, but that would be too easy. So now I get to uninstall the switch. A lousy product, I suggest buying another type of switch.
customer_reviews.author: Troy R. Ford

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL-works for short time then BREAKS
customer_reviews.text: Lights get stuck OFF or ON. Currently, my lights have been stuck ON for HOURS! The switch itself will NOT turn them off, or dim them. Nor will the Wemo app, neither can Alexa. The solution is, flip your breaker switch.....well Belkin/Wemo, my breaker is OUTSIDE of my house.....that is inconvenient no matter the time of year. Had I known this prior to purchasing, I would NEVER have purchased this junk item.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Completely unreliable
customer_reviews.text: When it works, its fine. But honestly its a toss up if it works. I constantly have to flip the breaker to the switch in order to "unfreeze" it sometimes while on and sometimes off, but you cannot even use the switch itself in that state. Beyond the freezing issues, these things constantly lose connection between the wemo site and Google home. I've also had issues with it losing network connections forcing a reset. Im considering tossing these for just dumb switches at this stage.
customer_reviews.author: JMR

customer_reviews.title: Super fun and great looking switch
customer_reviews.text: Installation was quick. The switch optimised itself for my LED lights for the max and min brightness. The design is futuristic. And minimal. It would have been great if there is a provision to customize the light strip on the switch. I can say that is the only con on this item.
customer_reviews.author: Balu Chinn

customer_reviews.title: WeMo is low
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work its unresponsive. Nothing but a dumb switch. Causes my LEDs to flicker and it gives me a bad headache my LEDs are made for dimmer switches and this dimmer switch is supposed to be a dimmer it does not dim.
customer_reviews.author: One Day

customer_reviews.title: Drops WiFi and locks up until circuit breaker reset
customer_reviews.text: Switch works okay, but keeps disconnecting from WiFi (other switches at same location are just fine). It constantly locks up and can’t perform assigned rules. A reset at circuit breaker box is the only way to get it back up. Returning my switch. Going to try the the exact model again. Wish me luck. ***UPDATE*** Replacement is working flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Won't Connect & Poor Service
customer_reviews.text: I have numerous wemo devices that connect fine to my wireless router. This dimmer won't connect no matter what I do. Belkin has sent a replacement, but it's not a device issue. I've followed all of the steps Belkin's basic support team could help me through. They escalated to second level support who has not called me although they have a 24-48 hr policy. After looking on the web, many many people have connection issues with wemo devices. It appears they are poorly designed from a networking standpoint.
customer_reviews.author: Silky J

customer_reviews.title: Please read this review first! Do Not Buy Any WEMO product! Or you will be frustrated
customer_reviews.text: Very simple! Do not buy it !!!you will be frustrated! There is no Apple HomeKit, it’s a big lie that it’s working with the App easily, even the customer support doesn’t know how to help, the make a case number for you and never call you back! For my case the engineer is working on it ! Lol 39 minutes talking with a technician! She was frustrated too
customer_reviews.author: Mo Hakakian

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but does dim really low like old manual switch
customer_reviews.text: I am a long time wemo product user and have been waiting forever for this dimmer switch. I had no trouble installing it and connecting to wifi and also getting it to show up in Amazon Alexa app. The only issue (minor) that I have is that my LED bulbs won't dim as low as the old manual Lutron dimmer used to do. The lowest setting on Wemo dimmer (even after manual calibration) is brighter than the lowest possible via Lutron dimmer. Now only if wemo could come out with a 3 way switch, I would be in wifi switch heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Arun Nair

customer_reviews.title: Freezes up every 3-4 days - BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 other Wemo product which are all awesome. This dimmer switch is crummy. Don't get me wrong, it is easy to install and setup. The issue is that every 3-4 days the product freeze up. The physical switch works but I cannot get Alexa or the Wemo app to work. The only way to get it working is to flip the breaker and reset it, then go through the set up again. I have tried to get support, but so far no luck.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Lowitz

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and works great with alexa and google home
customer_reviews.text: I use WeMo in my entire house. My first device was a light switch I've bought back in 2015 and since then I just stick with this brand. Never had a problem and when I think it could be a problem related to the problem, it was actually my wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Cury

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Apple HomeKit.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with Apple HomeKit as advertised. Tried to connect but never successfully could. I would not recommend this to Apple HomeKit users. It may work for Alexa or Google users though.
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: Was loving it til it froze and I could not cut the lights off!
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for close to 2 months then it would not turn off. I tried everything! I reset it, reboot it and the lights would not cut off. I have a baby I needed to put to sleep so I had to get a ladder and unscrew the light bulbs. It was a nightmare! Do your research! There has to be a better brand out there!
customer_reviews.author: MamaBear

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to detect and add on to our existing home applications
customer_reviews.text: These switches are not cheap but they really are top quality from the User Interface to the software our home automation software can detect. With these switches there is almost no set-up to do to add the switch to our Wemo application. We also use "Smart Home" and these work with that also.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory D. Guth

customer_reviews.title: Good smart home addition
customer_reviews.text: A great addition if you have other WeMo devices. I installed it at our front door to control the main living too light (that out kids turn and then forget to turn off). I set the Wemo to turn it off after being on for 1 hour...problem solved. A couple things: the box is slightly bigger than your standard box, so it’s a tight squeeze in the wall. Also, you need to connect it correctly (line/load/neutral) for it to work, so a little knowledge of electrical hook-up is needed. Otherwise, connect to home wifi was easy and it’s worked flawlessly since installation
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Must be re-set bi weekly seems like
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, easy to connect to WiFi and Alexa. Great when it works but seems like twice a month I have to reset it by powering it off via the circuit breaker. Becoming a pain in the............ Buying KASA dimmers from now on.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy yet if you want HomeKit integration
customer_reviews.text: Product boasts Apple Homekit integration, but the latest Wemo app apparently prevents it. This device does not use a HomeKit code, but apparently generates one dynamically. This is not working and Wemo support is providing no ETA when it will be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E. Stahl

customer_reviews.title: Dimmer was worth waiting for
customer_reviews.text: I currently have 11 WeMo devices in my home. I started with the Belkin devices almost 2 year ago, and suffered through their earlier bugs. However, the installation of the new Dimmer was by far the fastest and easiest. It controls 3 LED flood lights flawlessly. I'd add several more if the price drops. All of my products now work with different wifi repeater networks, an earlier problem , and firmware updates are painless. Great job team! I wish you had a 3-way switch version.
customer_reviews.author: JAF

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I decided to buy it despite the high price. I don’t think I would have done so if I wasn’t so impressed with the Wemo mini plugs I bought a few months ago. The dimmer works exactly as advertised, and like other reviews say, was easy to install and add to the Wemo app and Alexa. I actually rarely physically push on it - I usually use Alexa. My wife does not always like my smart home experiments but this one she likes a lot and actually uses.
customer_reviews.author: Mac N Cheese

customer_reviews.title: Works well with google home
customer_reviews.text: The good: It works very well with my Google Home. Commands to turn on and off and dim respond quickly. Flicker free dimming with LED. I do wish the lowest dim level was as low as my standard wall dimmer. The bad: The direct connect Wifi proves impossible to set up because on my Android phone the Start WiFI could not be turned off, so my phone disconnected the direct WiFi connection before I could configure with the mobile app. I had to use my Apple iPad to set up. I will likely buy another based on my experience with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kazoo Lemur

customer_reviews.title: Excellent switch
customer_reviews.text: Pretty awesome switch easy to set up and works amazing on the app - I installed it in my basement so I could control my new recessed lights. My favorite app setting is the the on/off feature - the lights automatically shut off after a particular time and this is great when my little girls are playing in the basement and come up for bed and I don’t have to bother going to the basement to shut them off the app takes care of it - bloody fantastic mate!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loses connection, Not worth the Trouble
customer_reviews.text: Losses connectivity EVERY TIME the wifi or router goes down, then you have to connect and setup again... for every switch you've installed. PAIN! I strongly suggest the cheaper and who built GE DIMMER and ADD ON SWITCH... they never fail and never need to be setup again, and again, and again, and again....
customer_reviews.author: Sam Kazery

customer_reviews.title: Love it, works well
customer_reviews.text: Love it, works well, set up wasn't all that bad, pretty straight forward. So far so good, works well with Alexa, I have ALS....Using my voice to control lights and fans is a game changer for me, even when I lose the ability to speak I can use my computer voice to still talk to Alexa. "Thank's WEMO, and Amazon for making my life a bit more manageable".
customer_reviews.author: Sunset 808

customer_reviews.title: Great Dimmer
customer_reviews.text: After being a bit skeptical of the item, once I installed it and saw how well it performed on my lights and all the features it has (like Amazon Alexa support AND Apple HomeKit), I like it a lot. I even ordered another for my office. Now every day this winter it turns on the lights 30 minutes before sunset.
customer_reviews.author: FunShop

customer_reviews.title: Issue when installing on interior outer walls
customer_reviews.text: I have had multiple issues with these dimmers not responding and becoming “stuck”. Especially on units installed on outer walls so it seems like they may be acceptable to high and low temperatures but when looking into these I never saw anything about potential issues with installing on outer wall boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Pull the trigger.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I prefer writing reviews once I have had at least a year + with the device in place. Having said that I have been using Wemo devices from the plug ins, light switches, link, and bulbs in multiple areas in my home and love their products. For anyone gun shy on using the Wemo brand devices; pull the trigger. I have been using these products well over a few years now and they just work. I was extremely excited to see the dimmer switch and will probably be adding at least a few more. I am not the type to give much of anything five stars, but I'm banking on the brand not specifically the device.
customer_reviews.author: Keolu L Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for daily basic on/off functions
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and use. Good product for daily use anyway. However, if you want to have a deep use , i.e. integration with your existing Alexa environment such as Harmony hub, it’s far away to get satisfactions ( actually no work with IFTTT applets , no support to Harmony remote and constantly self turning on after Alexa turning if off, etc..) compared to its rival products Lutron. But given the price with common use scenarios , you will still get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Yang Wen

customer_reviews.title: Every month it takes me 30 minutes to get it working again.  Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing drives me crazy. It seems like once a month it randomly stops working. I have to reset it in the Waymo app redo the Alexa app update everything just for 1 light switch. I am 30 minutes deep today in doing this and am over it. Screw this thing.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: The best experience ever with the installation
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded the whole house to WEMO from X10 devices. The best experience ever with the installation. 3 min settings in Wemo App on iPhone and 3 min in Alexa App on iPhone. Now I can control 6 lights dimmers and 4 lamps with Alexa by voice or from any iPhone in house. Only problem I had is because in one wall switch box I had only 2 wires (Live and load), no Neutral. My solution: I tuk an power extended cord and connect the Neutral to the switch neutral wire. In my case the heutral is common to the light and power socket neutral.
customer_reviews.author: Ovidiu Carstea

customer_reviews.title: That way i was able to acheive super low brightness
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it's supposed to. When the app is setting up the lowest dimmer setting and asks if the bulbs turned on with the lowest brightness level... I suggest saying no and then setting the lowest brightness yourself going up from zero. That way i was able to acheive super low brightness. Some app issues such as a dimmer will not respond and will come up after a refresh, but nothing that a software and firmware updates can't fix. I'm waiting to get the new Amazon echo so can't speak to the integration with Alexa yet but overall, great so far
customer_reviews.author: A. Ateeq

customer_reviews.title: Dimmer Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: I had installed the dimmer switch with no issues and it had calibrated and was working perfectly with my LED lights. Then after a week of use the dimmer feature stopped working both on the switch and on the app. The light would turn on and off with no issue, but stopped dimming. Really unfortunate because I enjoyed the switched until this issue occurred...
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Libby

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THIS DIMMER
customer_reviews.text: Bought 10 of these for a new house we are building. Out of the box the app wouldnt dimm the lights. If we wanted dimming we had to go to the switch. Alexa cant seem to find these things at all, tech support is non existant. And the headache and cost of having the electrician come back and replacing these right now is impractical. Going to use them as regular switches for now but i could have done that for $1 each at the hardware store. TOTAL JUNK. BUYER BE WARE.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Rhea

customer_reviews.title: Not fun to set up. Will absolutely require several internet searches.
customer_reviews.text: Dimmer works great. Setup is touchy - several things must be disabled via android and 5ghz cannot be used during setup, which were only discovered through slow crawls of forums. Several times during setup the app stalled out, resulting in starting from scratch. Took 2.5 hours to work through these kinks, but once up and running everything is flawless, including Alexa. Alexa support for "fade out" would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Josh English

customer_reviews.title: Won't dim all bulbs even if they say dimmer compatible.
customer_reviews.text: Have some under cabinet lights that were already on a dimmer and thought this would be a great place for a wemo dimmer. Well turns out the wemo dimmer cannot dim all brands of lights even if they say dimmer compatible. I had to unfortunately return the wemo as it would only turn the lights on and off, but would not dim at all. If they fix then I would rebuy, but cannot recommend at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Alexa yay, Homekit nay
customer_reviews.text: works flawlessly and easily with echo devices, couldn't be easier. It only recently got a firmware update to work with HomeKit and I could not figure out how to get to actually work with HomeKit, I'd wait until they update the instructions and give the QR codes for home kit integration
customer_reviews.author: Darren Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work like other Wemo devices
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these dimmer switches. All of them experience the same issue: every week or two, the app loses all recognition of the devices, and they start blinking red. You have to factory reset them, and completely re-install them in the app. I have had several Wemo outlet devices over the years, and they are stable. These dimmers just are flaky and unfortunately do not perform like you want them to. When they work they’re great, but I can’t recommend them. They are frustrating. Update 2 (10/21/18): Had to re-connect all dimmers again today. Will keep updating review, should be fun.
customer_reviews.author: 303AmazonJH

customer_reviews.title: Stops working every couple of months
customer_reviews.text: The setup and function of the switch are comparable to other wifi switches. It is fine when it works, but every couple of months it freezes. It won't respond to physical button presses, nor to the app. The reset procedure doesn't work either. The only way to get it to respond is to kill the power at the circuit breaker. Then it will come back up and work for a few more months. The fact that you cannot turn the light off at with the physical button is absolutely a deal breaker for me. I probably could live with a slightly buggy app. There is a thread on their support page where dozens of people have had similar issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Grimes

customer_reviews.title: After that temporary setback all worked great. My Echo occasionally says it has lost contact ...
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. Have it programmed to come on before sunset, dim at night and come back on before sunrise. Living in an old Victorian home from the 1890s some of my wiring is not up to standard. Found that my old switch did not have a neutral wire. Had to "borrow" a neutral from a nearby outlet. After that temporary setback all worked great. My Echo occasionally says it has lost contact with the Wemo but it still executes correctly with voice command. Excited to get the Smartthings hub next. Have ordered more Wemo devices after this successful "pilot" project.
customer_reviews.author: Even Brande

customer_reviews.title: Horrible noise from LED lights.
customer_reviews.text: The dimmer switch WiFi control works really nice. Unfortunately, the switch produces just awful buzzing/humming from the lights. I have it controlling six Torchstar 19 watt 5/6” recessed dimmable LED retrofit lights that are 18 feet up in the ceiling of a two story room. With the TV on at a modest volume I can still hear the lights at any level other than 100%. It drives me insane, it is so loud. Sadly, I will have to return the switch and revert back to the Levitron it replaced. That one works perfectly - just no WiFi control.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T. Kindlimann

customer_reviews.title: Not Apple HomeKit Compatible
customer_reviews.text: I have many Wemo devices that work great; this product from the seller states it is Apple HomeKit compatible, but it does not have the HomeKit icon on the packaging. Returning immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without it.  Makes life much easier!
customer_reviews.text: After having this dimmer, I would not want to be without it. You can do so many things with it and programing it is easy. For security reasons I purchased it so it would look that we are home when away. I also like the support that is provided through a internet chat or phone call. In addition, the WeMo switches do not require an extra hub that most other switches require.
customer_reviews.author: bulldog

customer_reviews.title: Alexa dimmer
customer_reviews.text: When you turn the light off Alexa can not turn it back on, she says “device not responding” but I still like it.
customer_reviews.author: Montanna

customer_reviews.title: Great Dimmers
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 3 of these dimmers so far. I have not had any connection issues since they have been installed which has been almost a year now. If you are an Apple user get the WeMo HomeKit bridge. The switches are more responsive in the Apple Home app rather than the Wemo app. These also have been working great and my Echo Dots.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Spear

customer_reviews.title: Junk dimmer
customer_reviews.text: Terrible dimmer. Won’t dim my can lights so replacing the bulbs is not a option. Other reviews have had same issue. Don’t waste you time. Get Etekcity dimmer instead. It just works out of the box with no fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Bob w

customer_reviews.title: Waited quite a while and now on receipt - pretty impressed.
customer_reviews.text: New review - 6 months. Just finished up with WEMO support. This will be my 3rd WEMO dimmer. Just keeps malfunctioning. This time the light "Switches" but relay does not switch load to turn on light. Last try. People who do not like "testing in the field" may want to look at alternatives for now. BTW, I have many other WEMO devices - all solidly reliable. Old review Easy install. Worked as advertised. Love the new Toggle Action ( would be great if they extended that to the standard light switch). Good quality enclosure. I love the face and faceplate - nice modern look. Need a double pole version - I would buy plenty.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine H. Briggs

customer_reviews.title: One works, two don't
customer_reviews.text: That's a pretty high failure rate. I can't get one to connect 10 feet from my router, but one downstairs, 3-4 times as far away works. I've tried replacing, it just won't find my wifi network. I really wish these things used bluetooth for setup.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Olson

customer_reviews.title: Not dimmable with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: You CAN turn the switch on/off with Alexa. You CANNOT adjust the brightness with Alexa. Not sure if the issue is with Alexa or WeMo, but the bottom line is that it doesn't work and according to an hour of internet searching, it hasn't worked since at least Jan 2018. Edit: At the suggesting from someone else that had the "server unresponsive" error, I tried it this morning and Alexa was able to set the brightness percentage. So as long as you only want to set it on Sunday mornings, you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: HPRice

customer_reviews.title: Love it!! With Alexa, made home theater lights voice-activated!!
customer_reviews.text: Installed in our home theater room, in conjunction with an Echo Dot and it's pretty awesome to just tell Alexa to dim/turn off/on the lights!! The instructions were very clear and simple to follow. My dad installed them pretty quickly. Noticed some lag at times, and sometimes Alexa would report an error even though the action completed successfully. But all in all, we're pretty pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: Buy this and it pairs with Alexa for audible control!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the dinning room because our old dimmer not was old and would keep falling off the knob when someone tapped on it to turn on or off the light. The installation for this device was a breeze, the calibration part was very intuitive. I will be buying more of Wemo products for sure. Thank you Amazon for the suggestion. ~Gerso
customer_reviews.author: Gerso G.

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have this integrated into my house IoT server and it works perfectly. WiFi signal reception is not the best and I do wish they would make these units to be less deep for the light socket in the wall...gets very tight with all the wiring.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: This does not work with Apple Homekit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dimmer switch primarily because it is advertised as homekit compatible. It is not. I installed the switch and set it up with the Wemo app, but it wouldn't integrate with homekit. After about a half-hour, with customer service, they told me that the device doesn't currently work with homekit, that engineering is working on a "work around", and they don't know when or even if the issue can be resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Christoph Rothschild

customer_reviews.title: I tried two and both started failing to connect to the wifi
customer_reviews.text: It works great for a couple days and they it fails to connect to wifi, and contrary to the older models when you could just restart the unit, the restart button becomes unresponsive too. the only way to restart it is to go to the breakers and turn the electricity off for the switch. The restart button does not work! Bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Cordobés

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: The product worked just fine out of the box. Disappointed that the dimmer only comes on full power when turned on by the scheduler. Can be manually turned on, or remotely turned on. Dimming is possible in those cases. Rules took a couple of minutes to figure out, but straight forward now. Works very well in my application.
customer_reviews.author: McGregg

customer_reviews.title: Light level not so easy to set by hand.
customer_reviews.text: The touch sensitive slider is not so responsive. It looks cool but you have to fuss with it to set the light level. Haven't gotten around to setting up the wifi/Alexa interface but see the the signal under Android Wi-Fi settings.
customer_reviews.author: mhaag

product_meta.title: WeMo (F7C059) Dimmer Wifi Light Switch, Works with Alexa, the Google Assistant and Apple Homekit
product_meta.description: Style:Dimmer Light Switch| Pattern Name:SingleSet the mood for dinner, work or movie time. The Wemo WiFi Smart Dimmer is the smartest way to create the perfect ambiance. Choose your desired level of brightness and set schedules and timers right from your phone or tablet so your lights do what you want when you want from anywhere. WeMo dimmer switch seamlessly replaces your existing dimmer switch and works with any one-way connection light. Easy install, perfect for diyers. Neutral wire required. Not recommended for use with a metal faceplate. Download the free app, and control your lights from your phone or tablet. No hub or subscription required. Wi-Fi Technology: 2.4GHz 802.11b/g/n. Minimum System Requirements-Android 4.4 or higher,iOS 9 or higher, Neutral wire required. Replaces single pole switch. Not compatible with 3-way (multi-location control) switches. Works with your existing single/double/multi-switch rocker-style plates. Not designed to work with metal face plates. Voltage Rating: 120 VAC; Max Wattage: 400 W Incandescent single-gang, 250 W Incandescent multi-gang, 150 W CFL/LED single or multi-gang.
feature_bullets: Control and dim lights from anywhere. Only needs Wi-Fi. No Hub or subscription required.
Control WeMo dimmer from the wall, the WeMo app, or with your voice when paired with Amazon Alexa, the Google Assistant and Apple homekit.
Syncs with your schedule. Easily set schedules and timers so your lights do what you want when you want. You can even sync lights to adjust with the sunset and sunrise
Optimize your lights: WeMo dimmer will calibrate to the bulbs you’re using to provide the maximum amount of dimming range with no flickering
Night mode. Set your WeMo dimmer to your desired low light level and protect your eyes from bright lights
Note: Works with any 1-way connection light switch (not compatible with 3-way) and requires a neutral wire
Note: Refer the user manual before use which is highly recommended
